definition: to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)
variant of 歲|岁[sui4], year/years old
classifier for years (of age)/year/year (of crop harvests)

sentences.english: Per capita incomes rose sharply last year.
Last year is dead, they seem to say.
sentences.chinese: 去岁已逝，它们好象在说。

definition: last year/the Chinese New Year (i.e. the new year in the old calendar)
just at that time/as it happens/by good luck, just then
to attend/to take office/to be present (in administrative capacity)
door to women's room/gate to palace
